enrl_requirement: Enrollment Requirements: Students who have previously taken and received credit for either BIOL_SCI 301 or BIOL_SCI 309 may not take this course. Students must also have completed Chem 210-1 or 212-1.
title: WCAS BIOL_SCI 308-0-20 Biochemistry
class_attributes:
Natural Sciences Distro Area

Prerequisites apply, see description

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: Basic concepts and experimental approaches in Biochemistry, emphasizing the structure and function of biological macromolecules, fundamental cellular biochemical processes, and the chemical logic of metabolic transformations.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: Biol_Sci 217 and 219; and Chem 210-2 OR Chem 212-2

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: Lecture style with interactive activities that engage students in applications of biochemical concepts (3D visualization wall). Evening discussion section.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Sapling Homework, quizzes, 2 midterms (the second midterm, or "Final" is NOT comprehensive)

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Suggested)
descriptions.value:
Students can choose to purchase either Option 1 OR Option 2 for this course.

? Option 1:
Biochemistry: A Short Course 3e & Sapling Learning Online Homework 6-month access card, Third Edition
ISBN-13: 9781319047344

? Custom version Option 2:
Title: Biochemistry a Short Course, paperback, 3rd Ed., customized for Northwestern. Sapling 6 Month access card. ISBN-13: 978-1-319-07941-3

descriptions.name: Class Notes
descriptions.value: Lecture slides will be posted the evening before each lecture

subject: BIOL_SCI
